data.headline: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq 100, and Russell 2000 futures all edge up less than 0.2% in quiet premarket action
bullets: Traders focused on the delayed January jobs report, expected to show 55K–70K new payrolls and 4.4% unemployment
Potential downward revisions to jobs data could impact Fed rate-cut expectations
Sentiment remains subdued with ongoing weakness in software and financials sectors
December retail sales came in flat, reinforcing softening growth but supporting dovish Fed hopes
Cloudflare and Teradata see earnings-driven premarket gains
Moderna drops sharply, down about 9% premarket
Busy earnings slate includes McDonald’s, T-Mobile, Shopify, Hilton, Kraft Heinz, Cisco, and Dollar Tree, with the latter receiving positive analyst coverage
